Header: Record snow, cold slams western U.S. with winter-like weather
Content: Midwinter-like weather clobbered parts of the western U.S. and into, making early autumn feel like deep winter. As much as 4 feet of snow fell in some places. Montana Governor Steve Bullock called an emergency after 40 inches of snow fell in parts of the state, forcing highway closures and a string of road accidents. Temperatures dropped to record lows in the -6.6 C or below. Snow also fell in areas of California, Nevada, Wyoming, Oregon and Idaho.
